snippet: The Food and Drug Administration said the widespread use of cephalosporins may have contributed to the development of drug-resistant bacteria that infect humans.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration announces that farmers and ranchers must restrict their use of a critical class of antibiotics in cattle, pigs, chickens and turkeys; say restrictions are necessary because such practices may have contributed to the growing threat in people of bacterial infections that are resistant to treatment.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said the widespread use of cephalosporins may have contributed to the development of drug-resistant bacteria that infect humans.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Restricts Cephalosporin Antibiotics in Livestock
headline.main: Citing Drug Resistance, U.S. Restricts More Antibiotics for Livestock
headline.print_headline: Citing Drug Resistance, U.S. Restricts More Antibiotics for Livestock
